identificationModule.briefTitle: Passive VS Active VR on HPT Using the Thermal Sensory Analyzer With a Peltier-Based Contact Thermode
identificationModule.officialTitle: Impact of Passive VR Versus Active VR on Heat Pain Thresholds Using the Thermal Sensory Analyzer (TSA-II) With a Peltier-Based Contact Thermode

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a prospective, crossover study of healthy participants evaluating the impact of passive vs. active virtual reality (VR) games on heat pain threshold (HPT).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Virtual reality (VR) is an emerging, non-pharmaceutical intervention used to reduce perceived pain and anxiety in patients. VR's effect on pain and anxiety on patients is well-studied as is how VR games improve recalled pain and anxiety in pediatric burn and bone-fracture patients undergoing painful medical procedures. However, how differences in VR application construction (such as passive play vs. active play) impact patient perception of pain and anxiety is not well understood. In this study, we will measure the impact of passive vs. active VR applications on heat pain threshold (HPT) and immediate vs. recalled pain and anxiety levels.

armGroups.label: Active VR then Passive VR
armGroups.description: Participant will conduct the experiment using active VR first and then passive VR
interventionNames: Behavioral: Oculus Go headset without active intervention
Behavioral: Oculus Go headset with active intervention

armGroups.label: Passive VR then Active VR
armGroups.description: Participant will conduct the experiment using passive VR first and then active VR
interventionNames: Behavioral: Oculus Go headset without active intervention
Behavioral: Oculus Go headset with active intervention

interventions.name: Oculus Go headset without active intervention
Oculus Go headset with active intervention
interventions.description: Participant will engage with the game display on the VR headset. Engagement time depends on the HPT limits test.

primaryOutcomes.description: Heat pain threshold measured by the TSA Air II device. Temperature ranges from 32 degrees C to 50 degrees C, with higher temperatures indicating a higher heat pain threshold.
Pressure pain threshold measured by a computerized pressure pain algometer. Pressure ranges from 0 kPa to 1000 kPa, with higher pressures indicating a higher pressure pain threshold.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Recalled pain level measured by a numerical rating scale (NRS) from 0-10. Scale ranges from 0-10, with higher scores indicating higher pain levels.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in lower recalled fear/anxiety level
secondaryOutcomes.description: Lower recalled fear/anxiety level measure by the adapted Fear Questionnaire (FQ). This scale ranges from 0-8, 0 indicating participants would not avoid the situation in the future, and 8 meaning they would always avoid the situation in the future.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* greater than 18 years of age
* English speaking
* hearing intact

Exclusion Criteria:

* a history of severe motion sickness
* currently have nausea
* history of seizures
* have hearing loss; are pregnant
* are currently taking beta blockers, chronotropic heart medications, or opioids or other prescription pain medications
* history of chronic pain or acute pain syndromes.
